Key Match Events: The Black Caps eased past Sri Lanka by five wickets
Trent Boult became the first New Zealander — and sixth man overall — to collect 50 World Cup scalps
Rachin Ravindra continued an outstanding tournament with a rapid 86-run opening stand
Post-Match Reflections: The Black Caps have battled through injuries and a four-game losing streak to essentially book a spot in the semifinals of the Cricket World Cup
The match will be a repeat of the epic two-day semifinal in 2019, when a five-win Black Caps eliminated the top qualifiers in Manchester
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Black Caps will face one of the toughest tests in cricket, as they will likely face India in the semifinals
Others: The Black Caps finished the round robin with a 5-4 record and a net run rate healthy enough to all but lock down fourth on the ladder
India have romped past all eight opponents at their home tournament, appearing almost unbeatable while boasting an in-form squad and boosted by fervent support
